system.description:
The Nemesis can make Cuts under specific situations. How and when you make your Cuts is determined by your What Is The Nemesis? choice and by your Dark Authority.

When the fellowship ignores you, you may Cut them.

When you Cut the fellowship or something they protect, it starts as a Soft Cut. While the cut is Soft, they may respond to it. When it becomes a Hard Cut, it happens, and you declare how the Cut plays out.

When nobody responds to a Soft Cut you made, or if they respond but fail to prevent it, it becomes a Hard Cut.

When you Cut a Companion or Threat while the fellowship can not protect them, your Cuts can be as hard or soft as you like.

You cannot make Cuts against a Threat to the World.

You cannot make Cuts while you are in Despair.

The Cuts are as follows:

  • Reveal an unwelcome truth: Tell them something they don't want to hear
  • Show signs of an approaching threat: Introduce a new danger or complication to the scene
  • Deal damage: Hurt them, physically or emotionally
  • Use up or take away their resources: Force them to spend their Gear or supplies
  • Turn their move back on them: Redirect or punish the move they just made
  • Separate them: Take them away from their allies
  • Put someone on the spot: Make a situation that needs their immediate attention or else
  • Present an opportunity: Give them a chance to succeed or beat you
  • Show a downside: Take advantage of a weak point in their actions or equipment
  • Tell them the consequences or requirements: Stop them from doing something they want until they go through you
